text:
Engineer Notebook

Take a look at stakeholder profiles from other students in your class. Then, in the text and sketch boxes below, note anything important you learned about stakeholders or design solutions in your community, any questions you have, any initial design ideas or sketches or whatever else you want to write about!

You can write or sketch in the boxes below (or do both). You do not need to write in complete sentences. If you don't know what to write about, you can answer some (or all) of these questions:

  • Did learning about water conservation design solutions in your community help you in your process of creating a water conservation solution? Why or why not?
  • Did creating a stakeholder profile help you in your process of creating a water conservation solution? Why or why not?
  • What are some assumptions you might be making about your stakeholders? How would you find information to clarify any assumptions?
  • What do you think you did well in today's lesson? What do you want to improve?
  • Explain what you think you should do next in your design process.
